dji.sdk.api.MainController

Class DJIMainController

  • java.lang.Object
    • dji.sdk.api.DJIObject
      • dji.sdk.api.MainController.DJIMainController
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DJIInspireMainController, DJIPhantomMainController

    public class DJIMainController
extends DJIObject

    DJI Main Controller Base Class

    DJIMainController provides a series of information and status about the drone. Customers could monitor the instant message by using this class. Every 1000ms, the callback of MainController would send back the message the drone contains.

    Also, the mainController requires that developers correctly construct the life cycle. There is a tutorial for setting up the life cycle.

    private DJIMcuUpdateStateCallBack mMcuUpdateStateCallBack = null;

    protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState){
      //other statements
      mMcuUpdateStateCallBack = new DJIMcuUpdateStateCallBack(){
        public void onResult(DJIMainControllerSystemState state) {
      }
    }

    protected void onResume() {
      //other statements
      DJIDrone.getDjiMC().startUpdateTimer(1000);
    }

    protected void onPause() {
      //other statements
      DJIDrone.getDjiMC().stopUpdateTimer();
    }

    Version:
    V2.4.0
    Author:
    DJI Software

      • DJIMainController

    • Method Detail

      • startUpdateTimer

        public boolean startUpdateTimer(int intervel)
        Start upating timer and set the interval between each update. The timer will request information of main controller status, and Error status. Developer could use setMcuUpdateStateCallBack and setMcuE rrorCallBack to set up the action while sdk receives the data.
        Parameters:
        intervel - Timer run interval. The input parameter interval could be not set up lower than 100.
        Returns:
        boolean true for successfully starting Update timer.
            false for informing failure.
        See Also:
        setMcuErrorCallBack(DJIMcuErrorCallBack), setMcuUpdateStateCallBack(DJIMcuUpdateStateCallBack)

      • stopUpdateTimer

        public boolean stopUpdateTimer()
        Stop upate timer
        Returns:
        boolean true for successfully stopping the updating timer
            false for informing failure.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        release Main Controller

      • getMcuErrorCallBack

        public DJIMcuErrorCallBack getMcuErrorCallBack()
        Get DJIMcuErrorCallBack. This callback will show the error by returning the errorcode.
        Returns:
        DJIMcuErrorCallBack

      • setMcuErrorCallBack

        public void setMcuErrorCallBack(DJIMcuErrorCallBack mMcuErrorCallBack)
        Set up the DJIMcuErrorCallBack. Please carefully organize the life cycle of the callback.
        Parameters:
        mMcuErrorCallBack - The main controller error callback.

        onError(int error) - the integer reflects the type of error.

      • getMcuUpdateStateCallBack

        public DJIMcuUpdateStateCallBack getMcuUpdateStateCallBack()
        Get DJIMcuUpdateStateCallBack. This callback will return a State object which contains the details information of flight.
        Returns:
        DJIMcuUpdateStateCallBack
        See Also:
        DJIMainControllerSystemState

      • setMcuUpdateStateCallBack

        public void setMcuUpdateStateCallBack(DJIMcuUpdateStateCallBack mMcuUpdateStateCallBack)
        Set DJIMcuUpdateStateCallBack. Please carefully organize the life cycle of the callback.
        Parameters:
        mMcuUpdateStateCallBack - The main controller update state callBack

        onResult(DJIMainControllerSystemState state) - state contains the information about the value of pitch, roll and yaw.
        See Also:
        DJIMainControllerSystemState

      • setMainControllerUpdateStateCallBack

        Parameters:
        mMcuUpdateStateCallBack - The main controller update state callBack

        onResult(DJIMainControllerSystemState state) - state contains the information about the value of pitch, roll and yaw.
        See Also:

      • setNoFlyZone

        public void setNoFlyZone(DJINoFlyZone zone,
                         DJIExecuteBooleanResultCallback mCallBack)
        Set no fly zone. The no fly zone restrict zones for the P2V+ flight. If the P2V+ is in the no fly zone, the P2V+ will be Forced to land.
        Parameters:
        zones - The nofly zones
        mCallBack - The result callback.

        onResult(boolean result) - the result will return a signal for judging whether the current place is no fly zone or not.

      • setFlyLimitParameter

        public void setFlyLimitParameter(DJIFlyLimitParameter para,
                                 DJIExecuteBooleanResultCallback mCallBack)
        Set Fly Limit Parameter. For example, zone latitude, zone longitude and the radius of the no fly zone.
        Parameters:
        para - The fly limit parameter
        mCallBack - The result callback

        onResult(boolean result) - the result will return a signal for judging whether the parameters are uploaded successfully or not.

      • getFlyLimitParameter

        public void getFlyLimitParameter(DJIMainControllerFlyLimitParameterCallBack mCallBack)
        Get Fly Limit Parameter.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - The result callback

        onResult(DJIFlyLimitParameter mFlyLimitParameter,DJIError mErr) - the result will be the flying limit parameters and the dji error result.
        If fail, the mFlyLimitParameter will be null.

      • setGohomeCmd

        public void setGohomeCmd(boolean goHome,
                         DJIExecuteBooleanResultCallback mCallBack)
        Set Go Home Command. Once the command has been received by the PV2+, it will automatically return the home point.
        Parameters:
        goHome - The go home
        mCallBack - The result callback

        onResult(boolean result) - the result will return a signal for judging whether the command is set successfully or not.

      • getSmartBatteryGohomeFlag

        public void getSmartBatteryGohomeFlag(DJIExecuteBooleanResultCallback mCallBack)
        Get Smart Battery Go home Flag. This flag will remind you of seriously considering the timing for aircraft return journey.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - The result callback

        onResult(boolean result) - the result will return a signal for judging the flag for going home.

      • SetSmartBatteryGohomeFlag

        public void SetSmartBatteryGohomeFlag(boolean flag,
                                      DJIExecuteBooleanResultCallback mCallBack)
        Set Smart Battery Go home Flag. The battery go home flag could be defined by the customers for different purposes.
        Parameters:
        flag - The smart battery go home flag
        mCallBack - The result callback

        onResult(boolean result) - the result will return a signal for setting up the go home level.

      • setStartCompassCalibration

        Set Start Compass Calibration
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - The result callback

        onResult(boolean result) - the result will return a signal for setting the compass.

      • setAircraftHomeGpsLocation

        public void setAircraftHomeGpsLocation(double latitude,
                                       double longitude,
                                       DJIExecuteResultCallback mCallBack)
        Set Aircraft Home Gps Location. If you want to adjust the home point, you should invoke this function with latitude and longitude of the next home point.
        Parameters:
        latitude - The latitude of location
        longitude - The longitude of location
        mCallBack - The result callback

        onResult(boolean result) - the result will return a signal for judging the flag for going home.

      • setGohomeAltitude

        public void setGohomeAltitude(float altitude,
                              DJIExecuteBooleanResultCallback mCallBack)
        Set Go Home Altitude
        Parameters:
        altitude - The go home altitude(m) [20m - 500m]
        mCallBack - The result callback

        onResult(boolean result) - the result will return a signal for judging the flag for judging the success of setting go home latitude.

      • getGohomeAltitude

        public void getGohomeAltitude(DJIExecuteFloatResultCallback mCallBack)
        Get Go Home Altitude
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - The result callback, result <= 0 --> invalid, result > 0 --> normal.
